creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
dimension: 14 1/2 × 9 3/4 in. (36.83 × 24.77 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳桐 {Yoshikiri} | Censor seal: 子三改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
text: Three separate sheets of a woodblock print forming one scene. A battle scene is depicted on a large black boat with white, green, and red bands. Figures are shown falling into the raging waters of the sea below. A man wearing a blue and white loincloth is climbing into the boat at center, another man in the upper left standing at the boat's edge decapitates a figure wearing red. Clouds of black and grey smoke surrounds the boat.
title: Picture of Masakiyo Conqering Korea
